trial_identification.studytitle: Nutrition, learning and behaviour: An investigation of psychometric assessments and feasibility of omega-3 fatty acid supplementation in indigenous childrem from remote Northern Territory schools
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Pilot study investigating psychometric assessments and feasibility of omega-3 fatty acid supplementation in indigenous children from 2-3 remote Northern Territory schools

conditions.healthcondition: Learning and behaviour in indigenous children from 2-3 remote community schools

interventions.interventions: Psychometric assessments conducted at baseline 1 (beginning of school term) and then after 9 weeks (baseline 2 - end of school term) followed by an open label pilot study providing 750mg omega-3 fatty acids per day (5 days per week) in fish oil capsules for 9 weeks during the following school term.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Literacy, assessed by the Reading and Spelling subtests from the Wide Range Achievement Test (WRAT)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Beginning of school term (baseline 1), week 9 (baseline 2), week 20 (week 9 of following school term after one term's fish oil supplementation)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Teacher ratings of children's attention and behaviour: Conners' Teacher Rating Scales (CTRS) short form
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Beginning of school term (baseline 1), week 9 (baseline 2), week 20 (week 9 of following school term after one term's fish oil supplementation)

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Beginning of school term (baseline 1), week 9 (baseline 2), week 20 (week 9 of following school term after one term's fish oil supplementation)
Beginning of school term (baseline 1), week 9 (baseline 2), week 20 (week 9 of following school term after one term's fish oil supplementation)
Beginning of school term (baseline 1), week 9 (baseline 2), week 20 (week 9 of following school term after one term's fish oil supplementation)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Children of consenting parents from small remote community schools

trial_design.concealment: Parents of children from small remote community schools in the Northern Territory will be approached to inform them about the study at their school and seek their consent.
trial_design.designfeatures: Psychometric assessments will take place at 3 time points - two baseline assessments at the beginning of one school term and week 9. Supplementation will commence at the beginning of the following school term and final assesments 9 weeks later.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this pilot study is to investigate test-retest reliability of psychometric assessments and feasibility plus community acceptance of teacher-administered omega-3 fatty acid supplementation in a remote community school. Baseline psychometric assessments will be conducted in July, second baseline assessments 9 weeks later and then 9 weeks of supplementation followed by final assessments.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Sinn N*, Cooper P, ODea K (2011). Fish oil supplementation, learning and behaviour in Indigenous children from a remote community school: A pilot feasibility study. Australian and New Zealand Journal of Public Health. 35(5):493-494
